channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Saliency-Augmented Memory Completion for Continual Learning
item.description: Specifically, we innovatively propose to store the part of the image most important to the tasks in episodic memory by saliency map extraction and memory encoding.

item.title: Improved Kernel Alignment Regret Bound for Online Kernel Learning
item.description: If the eigenvalues of the kernel matrix decay exponentially, then our algorithm enjoys a regret of $O(\sqrt{\mathcal{A}_T})$ at a computational complexity of $O(\ln^2{T})$.

item.title: Fewer is More: Efficient Object Detection in Large Aerial Images
item.description: Current mainstream object detection methods for large aerial images usually divide large images into patches and then exhaustively detect the objects of interest on all patches, no matter whether there exist objects or not.

item.title: Simultaneously Optimizing Perturbations and Positions for Black-box Adversarial Patch Attacks
item.description: Extensive experiments are conducted on the Face Recognition (FR) task, and results on four representative FR models show that our method can significantly improve the attack success rate and query efficiency.

item.title: Improving Complex Knowledge Base Question Answering via Question-to-Action and Question-to-Question Alignment
item.description: Complex knowledge base question answering can be achieved by converting questions into sequences of predefined actions.

item.title: SMMix: Self-Motivated Image Mixing for Vision Transformers
item.description: Due to the subtle designs of the self-motivated paradigm, our SMMix is significant in its smaller training overhead and better performance than other CutMix variants.

item.title: Orientation-Shared Convolution Representation for CT Metal Artifact Learning
item.description: During X-ray computed tomography (CT) scanning, metallic implants carrying with patients often lead to adverse artifacts in the captured CT images and then impair the clinical treatment.

item.title: Skit-S2I: An Indian Accented Speech to Intent dataset
item.description: Conventional conversation assistants extract text transcripts from the speech signal using automatic speech recognition (ASR) and then predict intent from the transcriptions.

item.title: TextBox 2.0: A Text Generation Library with Pre-trained Language Models
item.description: To facilitate research on text generation, this paper presents a comprehensive and unified library, TextBox 2. 0, focusing on the use of pre-trained language models (PLMs).

item.title: Learning Generalizable Representations for Reinforcement Learning via Adaptive Meta-learner of Behavioral Similarities
item.description: How to learn an effective reinforcement learning-based model for control tasks from high-level visual observations is a practical and challenging problem.

item.title: GAE-ISumm: Unsupervised Graph-Based Summarization of Indian Languages
item.description: Further, we experiment with the most publicly available Indian language summarization datasets to investigate the effectiveness of GAE-ISumm on other Indian languages.

item.title: Closed-form control with spike coding networks
item.description: The neuroscience theory of Spike Coding Networks (SCNs) offers a fully analytical solution for implementing dynamical systems in recurrent spiking neural networks -- while maintaining irregular, sparse, and robust spiking activity -- but it's not clear how to directly apply it to control problems.

item.title: Hybrid Representation Learning for Cognitive Diagnosis in Late-Life Depression Over 5 Years with Structural MRI
item.description: In this paper, we describe the development of a hybrid representation learning (HRL) framework for predicting cognitive diagnosis over 5 years based on T1-weighted sMRI data.

item.title: Improving Uncertainty Quantification of Variance Networks by Tree-Structured Learning
item.description: A tree is built upon giving the training data, whose leaf nodes represent different regions where region-specific neural networks are trained to predict both the mean and the variance for quantifying uncertainty.

item.title: Artificial Pupil Dilation for Data Augmentation in Iris Semantic Segmentation
item.description: The results indicate that our data augmentation method can improve segmentation accuracy up to 15% for images with high pupil dilation, which creates a more reliable iris recognition pipeline, even under extreme dilation.

item.title: Automated Gadget Discovery in Science
item.description: This process of gadget discovery develops in three stages: First, we use an RL agent to generate data, then, we employ a mining algorithm to extract gadgets and finally, the obtained gadgets are grouped by a density-based clustering algorithm.

item.title: Towards Blind Watermarking: Combining Invertible and Non-invertible Mechanisms
item.description: The CIN is composed of the invertible part to achieve high imperceptibility and the non-invertible part to strengthen the robustness against strong noise attacks.

item.title: On Realization of Intelligent Decision-Making in the Real World: A Foundation Decision Model Perspective
item.description: We therefore argue that a foundation decision model (FDM) can be established by formulating various decision-making tasks as a sequence decoding task using the Transformer architecture; this would be a promising solution to advance the applications of IDM in more complex real world tasks.

item.title: Nothing Stands Alone: Relational Fake News Detection with Hypergraph Neural Networks
item.description: Nowadays, fake news easily propagates through online social networks and becomes a grand threat to individuals and society.

item.title: Real or Fake Text?: Investigating Human Ability to Detect Boundaries Between Human-Written and Machine-Generated Text
item.description: As text generated by large language models proliferates, it becomes vital to understand how humans engage with such text, and whether or not they are able to detect when the text they are reading did not originate with a human writer.

item.title: COLT: Cyclic Overlapping Lottery Tickets for Faster Pruning of Convolutional Neural Networks
item.description: This research aims to generate winning lottery tickets from a set of lottery tickets that can achieve similar accuracy to the original unpruned network.

item.title: Deep Quadratic Hedging
item.description: We present a novel computational approach for quadratic hedging in a high-dimensional incomplete market.

item.title: Avicenna: a challenge dataset for natural language generation toward commonsense syllogistic reasoning
item.description: The Avicenna corpus was developed as a benchmark for syllogistic NLG.

item.title: ROS-Based Multi-Agent Systems COntrol Simulation Testbed (MASCOT)
item.description: This paper presents a simulation testbed developed for testing and demonstration of decentralized control algorithms designed for multi-agent systems.

item.title: A-NeSI: A Scalable Approximate Method for Probabilistic Neurosymbolic Inference
item.description: We introduce Approximate Neurosymbolic Inference (A-NeSI): a new framework for PNL that uses neural networks for scalable approximate inference.

item.title: The choice of scaling technique matters for classification performance
item.description: In this paper, we execute a broad experiment comparing the impact of 5 scaling techniques on the performances of 20 classification algorithms among monolithic and ensemble models, applying them to 82 publicly available datasets with varying imbalance ratios.

item.title: Benchmark for Uncertainty & Robustness in Self-Supervised Learning
item.description: Self-Supervised Learning (SSL) is crucial for real-world applications, especially in data-hungry domains such as healthcare and self-driving cars.

item.title: Finetuning for Sarcasm Detection with a Pruned Dataset
item.description: Sarcasm is usually conveyed through tone of voice, facial expressions, or other forms of nonverbal communication, but it can also be indicated by the use of certain words or phrases that are typically associated with irony or humor.

item.title: Physics-Informed Gaussian Process Regression Generalizes Linear PDE Solvers
item.description: Crucially, this probabilistic viewpoint allows to (1) quantify the inherent discretization error; (2) propagate uncertainty about the model parameters to the solution; and (3) condition on noisy measurements.

item.title: Using MM principles to deal with incomplete data in K-means clustering
item.description: Among many clustering algorithms, the K-means clustering algorithm is widely used because of its simple algorithm and fast convergence.

item.title: Precise Location Matching Improves Dense Contrastive Learning in Digital Pathology
item.description: Our method outperforms previous dense matching methods by up to 7. 2 % in average precision for detection and 5. 6 % in average precision for instance segmentation tasks.

item.title: NARS vs. Reinforcement learning: ONA vs. Q-Learning
item.description: One of the realistic scenarios is taking a sequence of optimal actions to do a task.

item.title: Large Raw Emotional Dataset with Aggregation Mechanism
item.description: We present a new data set for speech emotion recognition (SER) tasks called Dusha.

item.title: Rule Learning by Modularity
item.description: In this paper, we present a modular methodology that combines state-of-the-art methods in (stochastic) machine learning with traditional methods in rule learning to provide efficient and scalable algorithms for the classification of vast data sets, while remaining explainable.

item.title: A Close Look at Spatial Modeling: From Attention to Convolution
item.description: Vision Transformers have shown great promise recently for many vision tasks due to the insightful architecture design and attention mechanism.

item.title: Bring Your Own View: Graph Neural Networks for Link Prediction with Personalized Subgraph Selection
item.description: To bridge the gap, we introduce a Personalized Subgraph Selector (PS2) as a plug-and-play framework to automatically, personally, and inductively identify optimal subgraphs for different edges when performing GNNLP.

item.title: Predicting Survival of Tongue Cancer Patients by Machine Learning Models
item.description: The prognostic factors identified by our method are consistent with previous clinical studies.

item.title: HAC-Net: A Hybrid Attention-Based Convolutional Neural Network for Highly Accurate Protein-Ligand Binding Affinity Prediction
item.description: Applying deep learning concepts from image detection and graph theory has greatly advanced protein-ligand binding affinity prediction, a challenge with enormous ramifications for both drug discovery and protein engineering.

item.title: MicroBERT: Effective Training of Low-resource Monolingual BERTs through Parameter Reduction and Multitask Learning
item.description: Transformer language models (TLMs) are critical for most NLP tasks, but they are difficult to create for low-resource languages because of how much pretraining data they require.

item.title: Deep Unfolding-based Weighted Averaging for Federated Learning under Heterogeneous Environments
item.description: Federated learning is a collaborative model training method by iterating model updates at multiple clients and aggregation of the updates at a central server.

item.title: ProgNet: A Transferable Deep Network for Aircraft Engine Damage Propagation Prognosis under Real Flight Conditions
item.description: Then, ProgNet is transferred to the target domain of obtained degradation features for fine-tuning.

item.title: Image Classification with Small Datasets: Overview and Benchmark
item.description: However, as research in this scope is still in its infancy, two key ingredients are missing for ensuring reliable and truthful progress: a systematic and extensive overview of the state of the art, and a common benchmark to allow for objective comparisons between published methods.

item.title: CDO calibration via Magnus Expansion and Deep Learning
item.description: In the context of the large basket approximation, it is assumed that this is sufficiently large to approximate it by a limit SPDE describing the portfolio loss of a basket with size $K\rightarrow \infty$.

item.title: Robust Meta-Representation Learning via Global Label Inference and Classification
item.description: Empirically, MeLa outperforms existing methods across a diverse range of benchmarks, in particular under a more challenging setting where the number of training tasks is limited and labels are task-specific.

item.title: SiteFerret: beyond simple pocket identification in proteins
item.description: We present a novel method for the automatic detection of pockets on protein molecular surfaces.

item.title: Predictive Coding Based Multiscale Network with Encoder-Decoder LSTM for Video Prediction
item.description: As a predictive coding model, it is updated by a combination of bottom-up and top-down information flows, which is different from traditional bottom-up training style.

item.title: Ultra-High-Definition Low-Light Image Enhancement: A Benchmark and Transformer-Based Method
item.description: In this paper, we consider the task of low-light image enhancement (LLIE) and introduce a large-scale database consisting of images at 4K and 8K resolution.

item.title: Electromagnetic Based Communication Model for Dynamic Metasurface Antennas
item.description: Dynamic metasurface antennas (DMAs) arise as a promising technology in the field of massive multiple-input multiple-output (mMIMO) systems, offering the possibility of integrating a large number of antennas in a limited -- and potentially large -- aperture while keeping the required number of radio-frequency (RF) chains under control.

item.title: Certified Policy Smoothing for Cooperative Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learning
item.description: The experimental results show that our method produces meaningful guaranteed robustness for all models and environments.

item.title: Confidence-Aware Paced-Curriculum Learning by Label Smoothing for Surgical Scene Understanding
item.description: In this work, we design a paced curriculum by label smoothing (P-CBLS) using paced learning with uniform label smoothing (ULS) for classification tasks and fuse uniform and spatially varying label smoothing (SVLS) for semantic segmentation tasks in a curriculum manner.
